meanings.definition: A small, brush-like structure on the legs of certain arthropods used for grooming.
meanings.sent1: The scopulas on the spider's legs help it keep clean.
meanings.sent2: Arthropods use their scopulas to brush off dirt and debris from their bodies.
meanings.sent3: The tiny crab had a party, inviting all its scopulas to help with grooming.
meanings.sent4: Her scopulas were like tiny brooms sweeping away any unwanted particles.
meanings.sent5: The scopulas, like miniature brushes, meticulously cleaned each leg.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'scopula', referring to multiple brush-like structures on arthropod legs.
meanings.sent1: I observed the scopulas on the insects' legs as they moved through the grass.
meanings.sent2: The scopulas of the beetles were essential for their daily grooming routine.
meanings.sent3: The ant colony had a competition to see whose scopulas were the most effective at cleaning.
meanings.sent4: In the world of insects, scopulas are like magical cleaning tools attached to their legs.
meanings.sent5: The scopulas danced along the arthropod's legs, ensuring they stayed spotless.
